description: [U.S. Mission to the UN] MR. CAMERON HUDSON: Welcome again, Ambassador, and it's great to be sharing this time with you to talk about topics that are near and dear to your heart, to all of our hearts here, I think, which is the U.S. relationship with Africa. I want to start off by talking about kind of current day - where we are right now on some of the big issues, where the Biden administration will be leaving things, turning over to the Trump administration in just a couple of days.
title: Africa: Ambassador Linda Thomas-Greenfield - Reflecting on U.S.-Africa Relations at CSIS

description: [U.S. House] Washington, DC -- US taxpayer funding abortions in Mozambique 'tip of the iceberg'
title: Africa: Smith Calls for Full Congressional Investigation of PEPFAR Violation of the Helms Amendment

description: [allAfrica] Monrovia -- The Director General of the African Centers for Disease Control, Jean Kaseya, has said the center stands ready to support Tanzania and other countries in the region where suspected cases of the infectious Marburg Virus Disease have been identified. The World Health Organization earlier this week issued an alert warning of a possible outbreak in the country, although the Tanzanian Health Ministry has said tests conducted on available samples did not show the existence of Marburg in the East African nation.
title: Africa: 'No Marburg Confirmed In Tanzania', But Mpox Remains 'Public Health Emergency'

description: [WHO] Good morning, good afternoon and good evening, happy New Year, and welcome to our first global media briefing for 2025.
title: Africa: WHO Director-General's Opening Remarks At the Media Briefing - 16 January 2025

description: [WHO] Excellencies, Honourable Ministers, dear partners, colleagues and friends,
title: Africa: WHO Director-General's Opening Remarks At the Launch of WHO's 2025 Health Emergency Appeal - 16 January 2025

description: [Addis Standard] Addis Abeba -- Tibor Peter Nagy, former U.S. Assistant Secretary of State for African Affairs, has announced his return to the U.S. State Department in a temporary capacity.
title: Africa: Former US Assistant Secretary of State Tibor Nagy Returns to State Department

description: [Addis Standard] Addis Abeba -- The vibrant world of African fashion is set to take center stage as the 14th edition of the Hub of Africa Fashion Week (HAFW) returns to Addis Abeba. From 22 - 26 January, event organizers promise to showcase creativity, innovation, and cultural richness, bringing together designers, industry experts, and fashion enthusiasts from across the globe.
title: Africa: Art &amp; Culture - Hub of Africa Fashion Week Returns to Addis - Aims to Celebrate Creativity, Innovation

description: [Prosper Africa] Prosper Africa and African Export-Import Bank (Afreximbank) have signed a new Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) to boost trade and investment between the United States and Africa in key sectors. This strategic partnership aims to leverage the unique strengths of both organizations to mobilize trade opportunities and investment capital, with a focus on creative industries, critical minerals, emerging technologies, and textile manufacturing.
title: Africa: Prosper Africa and Afreximbank Announce New Partnership to Mobilize Trade Opportunities Between the U.S. and Africa

description: [Capital FM] The Kenya National Chamber of Commerce and Industry (KNCCI) is set to host the World Chambers Federation (WCF) Summit in Nairobi, marking a first for Africa.
title: Africa: Kenya to Host World Chambers Federation Summit for First Time in Africa

description: [Daba Finance] TLDR
title: Africa: Telecoms, Banks Drive BRVM to Record Market Capitalization in 2024

description: [Daba Finance] TLDR
title: Africa: African Banks Lead IPO Surge Across Stock Markets in 2025

description: [CAF] Wednesday night's draw for the TotalEnergies CAF Africa Nations Championship (CHAN) 2024 brought drama and anticipation as co-hosts Kenya landed in what many are calling the tournament's "Group of Death."
title: Africa: Kenya's Kamau Welcomes TotalEnergies CAF CHAN 'Group of Death' As a Challenge to Shine

description: [CAF] Tanzania's national team assistant coach, Juma Mgunda, has emphasized the challenge his side faces at the upcoming TotalEnergies CAF Africa Nations Championship (CHAN) 2024, scheduled for August.
title: Africa: 'No Easy Games in Africa' - Tanzania's Mgunda On Tough TotalEnergies CHAN 2024 Draw

description: [CAF] The quarter-final line-up in the TotalEnergies CAF Confederation Cup will be completed this weekend, as the race towards a place in the knockout stages enters its final stretch on Sunday, 19 January.
title: Africa: Blockbuster Sunday to Confirm TotalEnergies CAF Confederation Cup Quarter-Final Line-Up

description: [CAF] The Confédération Africaine de Football (CAF) has confirmed the draw procedure of the TotalEnergies CAF African Nations Championship (CHAN) 2024 Final Draw.
title: Africa: Draw Procedure - TotalEnergies CAF African Nations Championship (CHAN) 2024

description: [CAF] The Draw for the finals of the TotalEnergies CAF African Nations Championship (CHAN) Kenya, Uganda, Tanzania 2024 was staged in Nairobi, Kenya on Wednesday, 15 January and has delivered some exciting encounters for the tournament that will be played in August 2025.
title: Africa: Exciting TotalEnergies CAF African Nations Championship (CHAN) Draw Delivers Some Thrilling Encounters

description: [OCHA] Kyiv -- Statement by United Nations Under-Secretary-General for Humanitarian Affairs and Emergency Relief Coordinator Tom Fletcher
title: Africa: Gaza Ceasefire Offers Hope, Stakes Remain High, Says UN Relief Chief

description: [ISS] Progress has been slow during the AU's Decade of African Seas and Oceans. Five urgent steps can correct the course.
title: Africa: Sink or Swim - Africa's Crucial Maritime Milestones in 2025

description: [USAID] In line with the African Union (AU) Extraordinary Summit on the Comprehensive Africa Agriculture Development Programme (CAADP), hosted by the Government of Uganda in Kampala, USAID announced  a significant contribution of up to USD $9.95M towards strengthening the  Centre of Excellence for Seed Systems in Africa (CESSA) to support the building of functional seed systems on the content.
title: Africa: USAID Announces Additional USD $9.95 M to Support African Seed Action Plan through CESSA

description: [WHO] Conflict, climate change, epidemics, and displacement are converging to create an unparalleled global health crisis, with 305 million people in urgent need of humanitarian assistance in 2025. In response, the World Health Organization (WHO) is calling for US$ 1.5 billion for its 2025 Health Emergency Appeal (HEA), to support life-saving health interventions worldwide.
title: Africa: WHO Launches U.S.$ 1.5 Billion Health Emergency Appeal to Tackle Unprecedented Global Health Crises

description: [The Conversation Africa] Over the past 15 years there's been an increasing demand from within and outside the higher education sector for African countries to produce more PhD graduates. For this to happen, it's important to know what's holding people back from pursuing or completing their doctoral degrees. The authors of a new review article did just that, with a focus on South Africa, Kenya, Ethiopia, Uganda and Nigeria. Five themes emerged from their work: PhD candidates' sociodemographic profiles, access to funding, the
title: Africa: African Countries Need More PhD Graduates but Students Are Held Back By a Lack of Money and Support

description: [UN News] The world is facing an extraordinary convergence of crises that has left 305 million people in urgent need of humanitarian assistance.
title: Africa: Who Launches $1.5 Billion Appeal to Tackle Global Health Crises
